s3lB1Mvs6htRBlJsyDMflA.text: I love Azteca!  This location is large and bright, and is a great place for larger groups.  Although it always seems busy, I've never had to wait more than 5 minutes to be seated.  My favorite meal is the chicken fajitas, and the serving is more than enough to share with another person.  Service has always been fast and attentive.  Top shelf margaritas are generous with the liquor. ;)   My only complaint is that they recently changed their chips and I really dislike them!  They are thick and seem stale.  But, I'll still go and skip the chips, and have the complimentary sopapillas for dessert.

pbvn_XaiPwpP32tkl_lPzw.text: My second favorite Mexican Resturant in the area. Outstanding chips and salsa. The BEST table side guacamole anywhere.  Any of the steak dishes are amazing. Great service always.  And a large beer is a LARGE beer. Truly a outstanding restaurant.

w_uwvOLpXsSYTTH2S3bPiA.text: For Mexican food, I love to visit this Azteca location.  The service is excellent and they will substitute items on the menu.  As a shrimp lover, a favorite dish is the Carnitas Camarones which is prawns sliced and fried with onions, green peppers and mushrooms served with rice and beans.  They usually have a margarita special (mango = yummy) along with a beer special.  The restaurant is always crowded for dinner on the weekends.  Although the restaurant is pretty large, I suggest you arrive before the dinner time hour so that you don't have to wait.

X2L3i2FoRNIlgwhhVDuTYw.text: Every time I come to Azteca it's been a great experience.  Never have to wait too long to have a seat and the food is great. We go here a lot for birthdays because the food is so good and reasonably priced

CBv3DaOBLjpd9cuO9EJLpg.text: I have been here twice for lunch and both times were great. Large portions and fast service. The service was good but not great. But that shouldn't stop you from having a good meal.

2Tb6TMeQVakGfGQMQ4sBgQ.text: Oh my god! The closest to authentic moms Mexican food I've ever tasted! I had a chicken & pork enchilada with salsa verse drizzled all over just like I like it. & surprisingly the beans which are bland at most Mexican restaurants, were very tasty. Five stars for really yummy not your average Mexican food!

N2ftPzWl9qHM1UKADIBTpw.text: Love this place. Food is amazing!! Big portions and not expensive! I always et the chicken chimichanga and I couldn't be happier!!

YSegcyO_FJ9xCfixJEeMIg.text: Good value and service.  Fajita order was easily shareable and a bargain at $12.95.  Burrito wasn't huge but good flavor.  Chips were  very good.  Seemed more substantial than most places. Would  go back again based on the price.

BQrF9PpJjqu-sQLkGBfNIw.text: This is one of our favorite Mexican spots which is pretty consistent. Their chips are hot and salsa is pretty good,  I really like the fact that the queso ( white cheese dip) comes in a bowl size fit for sharing. For ex, Cabo's comes in an ittybitty  small as a finger bowl. It  is $5, plus it too runny for me. Anyway, Azteca's servers have always been attentive and quick for our needs. The food is reasonably priced and portions are nice.  He loves the chicken and shrimp fajitas and I really like the Pollo Poblano. Here, it is just right &  not too sweet like some other spots.

S4mQYhy2k2XAq6ZRU9r-lQ.text: Awesome service and an amazing wait staff!! Food is always impeccable and presentation is wonderful!! This is one of our favorite restaurants! You will not be disappointed!!

6BFWbMo4ilQp8y2oLdS51w.text: Great Mexican restaurant. My family and I have always used this place for special occasions. It shows you how good a place is when it is slammed full on a Friday night in Charlotte. Both locations can get full, so that is a sign that they are doing something right!

fG3kOrDb7jXlHTcV2J_V7w.text: WARNING! On June 25th, I ordered chicken tortilla soup to go from Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Smith Corners. After driving home and getting settled (nearly 25 minutes later) the container which was not secured by the manager who packed my order, spilled into my lap. I was rushed to the hospital where it was determined that I had received 2nd degree burns from their soup, through denim jeans, nearly HALF AN HOUR LATER! I have been given the run around from the restaurant, their management, and their insurance group The Main Street America Group who refuse to cover my just medical expenses or answer my questions. Those of you that know my family and I know that we are honest, hard-working people who don't ask for more than we are justly due. I am asking you join my family and I in spreading this warning by reposting this and boycotting this restaurant. If you do choose to dine with them, I don't recommend the soup.

AetELhsQ59ibyY4GiXf_QQ.text: Very disappointed with food and service. I am rarely in the University area but went to Northlake mall a few weeks ago with a friend and decided to grab lunch here. I have always enjoyed Azteca off Independence. I had been to this location several years ago and it was ok but not this time. The server we had apparently had  someplace he needed to be or would rather be. He was very impatient when we were trying to decide what to eat. Once we decided the meals were not as good as in the past. I ate less than half of mine and the server never asked if everything was ok just came by and said are you done and took my plate. Oh well, not like I would be going back here soon but now I will certainly not recommend it.

DvsYjVytXZWxX-CbN_MKwg.text: My favorite Mexican place in Charlotte by far. Great staff, super quick service, and delicious fare at reasonable prices. My favorite is pollo asado, but you simply can't go wrong. The real deal!

kBSymVoYhgzSmS7Mbu6ixg.text: Food and prices were good.  We had two plates that had mushrooms, one with chicken and one with shrimp and were pleased with both.  And, of course, we loved the cheese dip!

Xkw4uCGrvqDCpoBLm8n7eg.text: I orderee the pollo asada. It was quite delicious and the beans were delicious as well and i normally dont eat beans.  The chicken was flavorful and juicy. Only thing that could be better was the salsa because it was too watery.

S7didtHQz-x1Y3t8TgbAew.text: My family and I have enjoyed dining at Azteca for the past 5+ years.  We have never had a problem.  The food has been great, but today all that changed.  We went in for lunch and were waiting to be served and we saw a roach walk across the floor.  We called the wait staff over, but it was gone.  Then our food was brought to us.  Within minutes there was a roach on the wall next to me.  I was disgusted!  We showed the staff and got up to leave.  The staff didn't act surprised.  We were still made to pay our tab.  No manager came out to apologize. How many roaches must there be that they would come out during the daylight, casually walk across the floor and sit on a wall next to a customer?  We are not going back.

Lv9LtfQsmIjejJcnTs2wtw.text: This was my family's third visit to Azteca, and my fourth with my honey. It was his birthday, which I quietly mentioned to our server. Although, it was a Monday (June 1, specifically), the dining rooms and even the bar was crowded. That being said the service was prompt & pleasant. Having 3 hungry young men at the table kept the chips & salsa person busy. I knew better than to partake, because the entrees are huge. I did have a very large Margarita, and my honey and eldest son had 2 of the largest Does Equis that I've ever seen. Each time I visit I try to order something different, rather than my fave from my first Mexican restaurant in Charlotte when I arrived some 30 years ago-El Cancun. They too had an amazing air of authenticity & super food. My honey had a dish with the mole sauce (which is a delightful mix of dark chocolate & spices, my eldest ordered the Steak Azteca- a nice piece of meat with rice & refried beans. He said the steak was cooked perfectly, medium rare. The younger boys ordered the super nacho plate. I fell back on my old El Cancun fave- the large chicken burrito. I was not disappointed. It was filled with good quality chicken breast & all was seasoned to perfection. Portions were so large we all brought food home. Finally, my honey was amused to have the sombrero put on his head and have his birthday celebration. More to go boxes needed, as the boys brought home their dessert. I wasn't left out, as even though, I didn't order dessert, they brought over a couple of Cinnamon chips topped with whipped cream and a cherry! We will continue to go to Azteca, especially as summer comes, just to drink margaritas on the patio. Well done Azteca!!

vmuTDaQzpfHzHcOwa5G-Lw.text: Just had dinner their with my family who lives in Charlotte.  This is as good as it get's to authentic Mexican food.  The food was fresh and delicious. I highly recommend this place.  Just found another great restaurant to eat when I come to town.

3M4vx43l9NpiHIhx4IeALQ.text: I have been here for lunch several times, but we finally went for dinner last night - it was hopping! We each had a Fresh Margarita and it was delicious - made with fresh lime and orange juice. We ordered the fajitas (one shrimp. one chicken) and the Enchilladas Suizas. The portions are HUGE and we couldn't finish it all - try as we might. (No problemo! Leftovers are another meal in the future!) It was very busy with a mix of groups of friends to families to foursomes in booths. Obviously family friendly and very noisy, but not in a bad way. Will definately be back!

dvoA8Peu5MIHbbKFz24MHg.text: So my friend and I went here for lunch and was very disappointed in the food and service. For starters, our waiter had a terrible attitude. When we asked for a menu, he seemed to catch an attitude with us for not telling him what we wanted to drink first. After we had to get our own menu, he then went on to take our orders very poorly. It seemed to take forever for our food to arrive, and when it did, it wasn't what we ordered. I won't count this place out yet. They have one more chance with me. If next time is the same, stick a fork in it!

u2AZDb4Og555uO38sq6B0g.text: Very affordable lunch meals that will fill you up.  Excellent guacamole made at your table. Super friendly staff that seems to know exactly when your chips are running low.

OS1bBpn9d3kn-cIOr9isJg.text: The food was amazing! Huge, delicious portions at a great price. I can eat here and have leftovers for days. The margaritas are also huge and delicious.  My boyfriend ordered carnitas and loved how tender they were. I usually get a burrito azteca and take half of the plate home.  This is a great place for if you're really hungry or just want some authentic Mexican food. Azteca is legit.

sjwRHJgBA0skEa6HZN4DfA.text: The food here is so amazing! I came for lunch about a week ago and I was so happy with everything. They made the guacamole fresh right in front of us! It was sooooooooooo soo good. I ordered 2 enchiladas one chicken and one cheese Everything was hot and tasted great! The margarita my friend got was HUGE   Great value and great qualities.

dcNMtRQpPBSx1uSAQoMLyw.text: OK Mex.  Went here on a early Sat evening for dinner. We sat outside on the patio which was nice.  I had the two Amigos with grilled shrimp and chicken in a sauce of sour cream and melted monterray jack cheese.  It comes with refrios and lettuce with a choice of flour or corn tortillas. The taste was somewhat bland.  Their salsa was very heavy on onions which I didn't care for.

2_tRU75_l_GmompbVB7kqQ.text: I don't know how authentic it is but I love their Mexican Stir fry dish. The location makes it easy to get to. The food in the menu is exactly what comes to the table. Just as you ordered it. The staff is attentive but I wish it was a little faster.

ahi20Gm4_oLQyH7ndK1xBw.text: 08/24/11  Last meal in Charlotte before our flight.  Nice, bright atmosphere, and the restaurant was very large, which I couldn't tell walking in through the front door.  I liked the wood furniture and decor.  I had a feeling I'd been there before, but it's fairly new, and it was my first visit...  Everyone who tried the complimentary homemade chips and salsa enjoyed it.  I ordered the Two Taco combo, where I chose a soft taco filled w/ beef for myself, and gave a hard corn taco (also w/ beef) to my nephew.  Enjoyed everything else on my plate!  The "dirty rice" wasn't greasy, and I liked the texture and flavor of the refried beans.  Mom and sis shared a fajita combo platter, with chicken and shrimp, which they both enjoyed.  I'd sampled a juice (sorry, but forgot the name) drink that wasn't on the menu, but didn't like it- tasted like cough syrup to me, so I went ahead and ordered sweet iced tea.  Wouldn't mind going back to try their other lunch combos, or to have dinner there on our next visit to the Queen City!

WfoIqtpgINZLjxUdyJebOg.text: My shrimp ceviche was enormous and very good. Service was great, everyone made sure I enjoyed everything.

EaWJLbpwaEDh3MlKttV2DA.text: Oh my heavens!! This is hands down the best Mexican restaurant I have been to! So thankful for the kind couple who directed us here. Food is phenomenal, service is great, the wait time for our food was pretty quick. The portions are large large but honestly makes for the best leftovers!

rdprwjvTWk9hRGLiwbzwqA.text: Really not impressed. It was so crowded and took forever to get a seat. For two of us, too. Very generic Mexican food and not even that great.

Po5-zeDyLNGbsIa-xq3v4g.text: We enjoyed our meal tonight, the Paella and the Dos Amigos were both awesome!! We eat at a lot of Mexican restaurants and I highly recommend this one! The staff was friendly and attentive, we had a great experience

vWLM3Rj69Y_0Nhg5HhNPxQ.text: Staying in Charlotte for a week, asked the Hotel desk person where was a good Mexican restaurant. She raved about Azteca so thought I should give it a try. I walked in and was immediately  greeted and asked where I wanted to sit. They brought over chips and salsa [?] to be honest it really wasn't salsa it was very very watery with some raw onions.. almost no spice at all. I had to add salt to get any flavor at all.   I ordered the Pork Carnitas Plate. The plate its self was HUGE, however the pork carnitas took up only 1/8 or less of the plate. There were two sides of what i'm guessing was like a "fresh" vegetable salsa maybe. I tasted it but it was really odd/dry/no taste. Then the rice & refried beans. The person who made the beans must have made the salsa for the chips as well. They were very very thin...to the point they would fall though the tines in my fork. No cheese on them and again no seasoning/spice.   Now i'm honestly not trying to be negative towards the restaurant everyone else seemed to really enjoy them... so i'm guessing it has to be that with living in California we have real Mexican food practically on every corner especially with the taco trucks and they are not afraid of spice at all. It was just very different and didn't appeal to me at all...if i came back I would not give them another try...Sorry.

Uonduw188gf1FmFDzmv9xQ.text: This place is hard to find since it's off from the main road.I like the decor and service. Our server was very nice. It's a big pricey for a place like this. The food are ok. My brother's stake was hard to cut. I ordered Taco which came in with rice and beans, and I liked it lot. I might not go back again and definitely going to find another authentic Mexican place. Sorry! :(

HSJ_Cste19GjRRQNfgaaLg.text: Seriously best Mexican food I have ever tried! Love coming here and getting steak tacos or carnita tacos. I truly believe they would be more popular if their location wasn't so hidden.

OhddeDyv-GEGdbWsIxAQ7w.text: The food is always great. The people are nice. Service is excellent. I've eaten there 10 times now and every meal was a good experience.

fPNTPZ3Q2NpNMDYznAWx2Q.text: Excellent Mexican food. Glad I looked at Yelp first. Staying nearby for a couple of nights. Read the good reviews and decided to try it. Granted, it was late on a week nite but the service was excellent. I had the chorizo burrito which was fantastic. I don't see chorizo served at a lot of Mexican restaurants.   Well done!

boodWKc91nDGqjD3fNhPvQ.text: Their nachos tasted like shit and i didn't even know that was possible. It was also expensive. Just stay away from this place.

6FaAWKuIr3kwS7eE0dEQhg.text: Service here is not good at all. I came Tuesday evening at 9pm with a friend and we wanted some good Mexican food. DxS9CeGCdwDnuss7w0CJqg.text: This was the most awful lunch experience I have EVER experienced. Every little thing from the moment my family and I sat down, was AWFUL. We sat down for 20 minutes before someone came to give us chips and salsa (without even taking a drink order). When our drink order was finally taken, every drink came back MELTED and liquid instead of frozen like ordered. Our food came out 30 minutes later, and two of the orders were completely wrong. Their quesadilla is a form of processed cheese slices btw if you were thinking about ordering that from here. By this time we have had 4 different waiters/waitresses as well. I ordered a taco salad with chicken. It was a good dinner, we had a great time and if I'm in the area I'd stop here again!

Ny__2MgzGsnE9np0-3N8Sg.text: This place is pretty hidden up in the North Lake mall area, but it is great!  I did not have high hopes for it, but I have been there 3 times now, and each time has been awesome.  The Margaritas are huge! (order the Cabo Wabo margarita)  The juices are fresh and the tequila is strong.  Two of these will set you up nicely for the evening, and they aren't even that expensive.    For food, the queso is delicious, but the real highlight is the steak quesadilla.  The steak is delicious and has soo much flavor.  I love coming here, even though it is 15+ mins outside of the city.  It's under the radar, but I will keep returning.

XYedG9rx7KW7zgND7BpKRg.text: My first meal at this restaurant was sitting at the bar.  I had the shrimp fajitas and enjoyed them tremendously. Flavor was great. The service is very attentive at the bar.  We went back the same week and had the shrimp fajitas again.  Again I really enjoyed them.  Then we went again a couple of days ago and shared the chicken nachos.  There was plenty of chicken for both of us.  The flavors all worked together.  There was a good balance of all ingredients including cheese, guac and sour cream.

656pT0mamXGglZjesxGIqA.text: Authentic mexican food for a great price! Delicious margaritas && tasty tacos! Always great service && very clean.

dNQSq3YP6lymE3vLUEmQ7Q.text: I was thinking "Yeah I'll give them a 4-star review!" but then I realized I have no experiences which led me to think they deserved less than five!  First of all I can't believe it took me so long to finally check this place out. Considering I live just around the corner and have basically commuted past it for over 4 years. When you come in you are typically greeted in Spanish with an "Hola" before being brought to a table. As with most Mexican restaurants they have what I would call a chip busboy. Basically a guy that is dedicated to running chips around to people that have just been seated. When you get your chips and salsa, don't forget to ask for pico as well. There is no additional charge and it is a bit spicier than the salsa. (I just dump the two together in one bowl and dig in.)  Probably the most notable thing here is the size of the plates. You're thinking "Sure, big plates with lots of garnish. Big whoop." And you're right, it's one thing to have a big plate and another to fill said plate. Azteca fills 'em so you can fill your guts. Edge to edge, 360 degrees. Ever heard the saying that empty space helps compliment the items in an area? No it doesn't, fill that spot with rice, refries, salad and cheese-enchilada sauce melted over the edges. That's right Bojangles, you can keep your tiny biscuit cheese-skirt. Azteca's is bigger, better and blankets an enchilada stuffed with delicious. (Yes, delicious is a noun now.) As far as enchiladas go, I can highly recommend the menu item Enchiladas Suizas. You will be happily plump on less than $10.  Round-out your filling meal with a few of those easy-to-drink Mexican beers. Last but not least you will receive a pie-like slice of crispy sopapilla topped with a sweet cinnamon glaze and whipped cream. You might even think you could eat a whole Azteca-sized plate of these. (Let's not push it though...)

zEoMMFdUmGJ2fHfauQ43Cg.text: Went to dinner here for a late night with my family  on 7.23.16. I was actually trying to decide  between Don Pedro's and Azteca . I decided to go to Azteca since I had never been before . Upon reviewing the menu , I noticed it looked eerily familiar to Don Pedro's, after chatting with the waiter it was confirmed that they are more or less the same restaurant and share the same menu , interesting !  Anyways  back to the dinner , the waiter took our order without  any issues and came by to see how we were doing prior to our food  coming out and seemed  like a pretty nice guy . Unfortunately that was the last we heard of him ,He just disappeared after that .  The food came out and everything was ok .   A lady named  Ana ( who seemed really nice ) , was able to get our check and let us pay . I was never told of what happened to our waiter .   Within hours of eating the food ( Fiesta Chimichanga and chips and salsa) an explosive sickness came over me like no other and left me running to the  bathroom from 4am to nearly 10am . Yikes !!!   I definitely didn't order a side of food poisoning or whatever that was , with my chimichanga . Nonetheless I'm glad it didn't last too long and after about a day I'm feeling pretty darn good again :) . Probably won't be going to either Don Pedro's or Azteca for quite some time.

5jWchLxAxG7STkCHCkrDDw.text: I'm in Charlotte for a week.  I have no problem eating this for dinner every night... but my waistline will!  Tons of tasty food for a really good price.  Wow!  Solid rice & beans served with a side of cole slaw -- and this was the SIDE to my entree (tamale/chile rellano/enchilada combo).  Today was takeout, but tomorrow -- going to try the dine-in option!!!

DoLKj8RphZ54sUfd0saf8w.text: I have been coming to this location since 2001. The place has not changed very much, typical  "Aztecan" theme. Very colorful, one thing I can say is this place is very clean. The food is amazing the closest thing you will get to going to Mexico. I love the arroz con pollo, the wait staff has changed a little bit and that is why I am giving it four stars.They need to have a little more friendliness I shouldn't be able to read I don't want to be here on your face.

vNWRP6znV6EE5KnngLBl8w.text: The food was horrible, the service was worth. My 5 year old ordered a Quesada and got a taco instead. Spent 45.00 for LUNCH. On the LUNCH special menu. Tried to explain the food was inccorect and was insulted. Will NEVER return. Was refused when asked to speak to a manager. Do not eat here. Horrible.

dAOeCyRHsOtObIuq-o2nGw.text: First time here with friends and it will be the last. Sorry, but the food was horrible. Don't  know how people give 4 and 5 stars. Chips and watery salsa, to start. My tableside guacamole lack seasoning just smashed avocado with some onions and cilantro. Nothing impressive. My shrimp cocktail had a lot of shrimp swimming in a bowl of ketchup and the ketchup was hot. Yuck! Last of all the Botana Azteca had bacon wrapped shrimp completely overcooked that if it fell from the table it will bounce. Also lack of seasoning. The other shrimp on the plate was also overcooked but it was so salty you couldn't eat it. $49.00 pls tip for nothing. The only good thing was Ubaldo our waiter very attentive. I will definitely  NOT be back. .

7eG2oZxJWM01D4RT7f922g.text: I went here for my birthday and wish I hadn't. The service sucked as my friend kept having to track someone down for chips, salsa, drink refills, and everything else. The ACP sucked in comparison to other places I've been.

NKwBCX-QaPZI3epOXYrGvg.text: Great service... I'm from California and this is just as good as the Mexican food I have had in California.

kQZX_8T3zE7yKhieP63WgQ.text: I came here last night to meet up with a few friends. I'd never been here and wasn't too excited about it because I'd just had Mexican food last week, but decided to go simply for the fellowship. I walked in and was greeted immediately. I was the first person to get there so I got us a table. The waiter came right over and asked if I wanted anything to drink. I ordered the blue margarita which was actually really yummy. The chips and salsa were AMAZING!!! I usually ended up adding seasoning to salsa at Mexican restaurants because they're typically bland, but this salsa was perfect! I ordered a shrimp dish with rice, mushrooms, and onions and was surprised to see how big the dish was! Our food came out in a timely manner and looked amazing. I made the HUGE mistake of going to the restroom before digging in. As I walk in, I pass an employee standing at the sink texting on her phone. Out of the 3 stalls, two of them were dirty. A lady came in after me and went into the stall that I'm assuming was at least decent. I go into the lesser of two evils and, just to my luck, the door is broken and it won't close properly. UGH!! I was forced to go into the stall that needed attention and just flushed the toilet before using it but soon realized that I should've just waited for the lady to finish in the decent stall. I had no tissue!! I guess the employee was too busy making sure the text was sent to whomever to check the cleanliness of the bathroom. I go up to wash my hands and see used paper towels in one of the two sinks. I guess she couldn't be bothered enough to even throw the paper towels in the trash. Those texts must've been super important. I had to force myself not to think about what I saw in the bathroom as I went back to eat my food. I had to push the image out of my mind and try to shake it off. Yuck!! My food was DELISH and I was more than pleased. The staff needs to pay just as much attention to ensuring that restrooms are clean as they do the food because this makes for a complete experience for the guest. I would recommend this place but will warn you, use the restroom at home before coming in here.

9ih-BBVjWnUMJOz-VWbteQ.text: We went to charlotte for the nascar race and stayed at a hotel near this restaurant. The location was very convenient since it was right across the street and we were pretty tired. The food was great! I had the shrimp enchiladas and they were pretty good. We also had a margarita pitcher which was good too. Service was excellent. No complaints.

D7TbEsM4nXRzkJZcxpg5bw.text: I am giving Azteca 1 star for a few reasons. I called in my food at 3:33pm. Given that it's not during the dinner rush, I expected my food to get done quickly. They told me it would be ready in a, reasonable, 15 minutes. 15 minutes later I arrived to pick up my food. I told them what I was waiting for, then stood and waited another 45 minutes (one hour total time) for my food to come out. After waiting one hour I was told that my two burritos would be $38. I told them that must be a mistake, as all I ordered was two chicken burritos. There was no way they could be $19 a piece. I did add cheese to them, which I agreed to the $1.25 up charge for. They insisted that the price was right, and my two chicken burritos would be $38. (Side note: I recently went to chilis and shared two margaritas, an appetizer, two dinner entrees, and a desert, for $35)  One hour of wait time, and $38 later, I left with two mediocre chicken burritos that I could have gotten for significantly cheaper at most any other Mexican restaurant in the area. I will not be back.

ZjEumRBVPOrlHlagDBRemQ.text: It was very good fresh food. We enjoyed the guacamole they make at your table side. The fajitas were enough for both of us!! We recommend  this Mexican restaurant.

oIAZR3ZFIPlySghBg-UwHg.text: Great food, drinks and fantastic service makes Azteca an area favorite. There is something for everyone in your groups taste on the menu. You must give Azteca a try.

zl-kUJ0yJCHrms6LVq97ZA.text: Official Mexican restaurant! And I'm Mexican, so I think I know. As soon as you walk in you know, you smell those spices and the entire friendly, brown staff,you just know. My wife and I have made it one of our regular spots.

lDk0nLoB5_xAfztwi5FLZw.text: Had lunch here yesterday.  Been a while. I keep forgetting about this place even though it is basically across the street from my office.  But it is buried deep in a strip mall type area.   Anyway the lunch was great. I had a deluxe beef burrito. It was huge. Otherwise nothing unusual at all. But very fresh, tasty, and satisfying.   Service was friendly and prompt. Prices average for this type of spot.   All in all a winner. Not a go out of your way place. But if you're in the area, and feel like Mexican food, worth the stop

HtLj2drkvmQ-27hSxBRzyA.text: Had a terrible experience here.  First we ordered cheeses dip and once it came there were no chips.  By the time our chips came, the cheese dip was cold - wasted $5.  Then we waited 40 minutes more before asking for the manager.  The food came 5 minutes later and the manager didn't show up for another 5 minutes! No apology, just excuses that they were so busy that even he had too work in the kitchen so everyone's food would be hot when served.  Food was okay at best.  We will never go back.

zyQJNO2nevii_ffYU_Z3vQ.text: Full disclosure: I'm not a big fan of Mexican in general beyond tacos that I cook myself at home.   That said, this place is pretty great. Price is reasonable for the mountain of food you get with most meals, and the service has always been friendly and fairly prompt when I've eaten here. I've only ever been for dinner, so one of these days I need to do the lunch test and see if it's doable in a 'typical' lunch hour or not.   For the one or two times a year that I am in the mood for Mexican, I go with Azteca!

Fa8SLmz4pQNtpi9eDMScSg.text: Pros - fresh  Cons - limited to 2 small baskets of chips (before charge), small entre, loud music.   Taxco in Huntersville MUCH better!

kImRMjCPAai-vRK2COBkzA.text: Not your mom's arroz con pollo.  But a suitable alternative.  Nice variety on the menu if you are looking for a little more than your typical Mexican favs.

aPBHTZRi7Lbt-6VgwqliEg.text: I have to say I wasn't too impressed with this place. Food was ok but the service was pretty awful. No salsa or drink refills. Ive been twice now and I don't think I'll go again.

Oa8sEpIbxcQ3tWcIbsJSfw.text: The food was good, but it's a bit over priced. My burrito literally only had the steak in it.

I7lKSp9zUi8neXDFkbuFCw.text: We have ordered take out from here several times and finally stopped in the other day for lunch. They have amazing salsa, lots of cilantro which I happen to love. They don't have many vegetarian options on the menu but they do a have a few. The vegetable burrito was delicious and the portion is huge. The waiters were nice and quick with everything. All in all I would def. go here again and we will continue to get take out from here all the time!

2pl9qMTx7BvSBVLM1hohJw.text: Subpar to say the least... Definitely won't be eating here ever again. Very bland food. Blah.

lrWwTA6N3Gam9hFmny3MPA.text: Best Albondigas Soup in the US!!!!  We moved to SC from Southern California, where we thought made the best Mexican Food, but Azteca Mexican Restaurant has it down like no tomorrow!   My husband and I both ordered a bowl each. He went ahead and ordered the pork Carnitas, but I knew the bowl was going to be big based on the price, so I held off ordering anything else. First, our waitress brought a small bowl 1/2 filled with chopped white onion the other 1/2 filled with chopped Cilantro and on top was a slice of a lime!!!! When the bowls of soup arrived our eyes nearly bugged out of our heads!  It was AMAZING! So amazing that we told our waitress to tell the manager and she got him for us!  Alex is a very concerned, very gracious manager. He was so happy that we were so happy!  You MUST try a Frozen Mango Margarita!  Again, the best we've ever had!!!! By the way, the Pork Carnitas were very good also, it was just that my husbands eyes were bigger than his stomach and I was so very happy with my Albondigas Soup!  If you like really good Mexican Food, go see Alex and tell him Joe and Monica sent you  :)

wvSH4a0dCqsiu8yI_6pQoQ.text: Basic boring Tex Mex, but hey the place was packed. They know what brings them in, so who am I to judge.    There were some nice touches that bring it up a notch or two over similar restaurants - generous use of cilantro, pickled onions and cactus salad with the carnitas - but they were negated by the over cooked carnitas meat, packaged corn tortillas and tasteless Huevos Rancheros.   The restaurant itself is huge and colorfully appointed; service is very good. The bill for lunch was very inexpensive. Despite everything this is actually one of the better choices around Northlake; but that says more about the dearth of good dining options in that area.

3x3PA8XIg6hhyNvOdDEutQ.text: New to town my boyfriend and myself went due to the raving reviews. HonestLY we were pretty disappointed. I used to work in a Mexican restaurant that was rating the best by the state and I didn't recognize half the food. Also I though it was strange my dish came with  coleslaw....and I'm pretty sure it was spoiled. The food was mediocre , but not excellent. My boyfriend insisted the chips tasted like sweat. BUT the reason I WONT go back is their margaritas. You get the choice of size and flavor, that's it . I figured I start off with a basic strawberry and I had 2 by the end of the meal. They were not worth it. 4 margs came to $34!! I was baffled. PASS

YMNl2hi0M9td-O4hljg8BQ.text: I really enjoy coming to Azteca!!  Mexican is my favorite food and this place is awesome!!  Great food and great service!  And the prices are reasonable.  I have also been to the one on Woodlawn and it's just as nice!  The servers are always upbeat and friendly.  I would really recommend you come and try :) I will definitly be coming back!  I have many times!

YaMtHnOf2Oek5Xlw83_hQA.text: Tucked away near Northlake Mall, you can find yourself some pretty good Mexican food. Fellow Elite friends recommended Azteca, and it was a hit! The food was delicioso -- good chips, great tacos, your choice of black beans or refried beans with your meal, and excellent rice as a side. Good drink selection and fair prices. Nice but not huge outdoor seating area. Great service and friendly staff. Obviously popular with the families, but don't rule it out if you're younger and unattached! This is definitely a good option when you're in the area and jonesin' for a quesadilla and margarita.

TS6YFg6oRO61r_5-HeJXpw.text: Very good food here! The plates were huge!  The salsa was awesome! Horchata was delicioso! I'll definitely go back for a good Mexican meal!

TuSIkF8L8oU8Sutq1PtPXQ.text: This is my second visit to an Azteca, but first to this location. The service was spectacular. They had us covered on everything before we even had a chance to tell them we needed it. Drink refills, salsa, chips. Was great. Food was great as usual. Both our meals were right, no issues. Just like the other location, would not hesitate to come back.

7NvwwLKkOsW952XBSykqtg.text: Great restaurant for authentic Mexican quisen. They also have a bar.  I got the fiesta chimichanga. It was mouth watering.

I-fCZYwlO0eZDu9OhDVG_g.text: Started with a virgin pina colada..the glass of which was humongous. But i loved it.. Their complimentary chips were fresh and crispy, the salsa was tasty too. We ordered the guacamole and this part is interesting : the waiter made delicious fresh guacamole direct from the avocado fruit, right in front of us :D :D. For the main course, i shared the enchilada , tostado combination with my mother. it was good.. I took away one star because being a vegetarian, all dishes come with the same same black bean filling. so apart from the presentation all the dishes taste pretty much the same. So for this I wont blame it on the restaurant but ya just doesnt make me want to give full stars. Nice interiors, friendly waiters and good food.. u shud definitely go if in the area ..totally worth it..

4QrGRhKqpJ6bBtT-2uZVxA.text: This place is wonderful!! I was greeted promptly upon walking in the door, and the guy at the bar was very quick to take my order. They have like six wall mounted Televisions in there and they were all playing ESPN that was a definite plus!! I had a shrimp quesadilla and it was the best I've had yet and I was not disappointed. This is definitely a restaurant that I would return to. The portion of food was great and even though I took my order to go they offered chips and salsa while waiting for my food, and they also gave me more chips and salsa with my meal to go. I loved the service and this place is great.

_h1a6ko7Hrd8Hoo9p6aRPg.text: BEWARE! This place is disgusting. Me and a coworker went for lunch and the food was so dry and tasteless that we had to send it back for them to remake it. They thought we wouldn't notice that all they did was add water to the food! The shrimp I ordered was very chewy and tasted old. My coworker got sick the next day after eating there and the salsa was so watery. I decided to give this restaurant a second try and ordered the whole fish. First and foremost they fried the fish in oil and didn't put any seasoning or butter. I asked the waitress why they didn't season the fish but only throw it in oil and she replied that's just how we cook it. I had to throw the entire meal away and once again the salsa looked and tasted like water that was dyed red. In my opinion this was the worst Mexican restaurant I've ever been too I guess it's in the cut for a reason!

J7Hark0MaENbkJ5yUFuyNQ.text: The guacamole is fresh and taste very good. The cheese dip was very runny, and not very tasty. The Aztecs mix plate I ordered was not a little disappointing, the meat was very thin and flavorless, shrimp on the other hand were very well seasoned. The flan dessert was absolutely delicious. The over all service is very good.

RbwoZTjJTJQc5s-XXWc0rg.text: My motto is do no harm but I wanted to be fair..I took 5 of my family members there and we had dinner. My mom and I had fajitas - ALL of the servings are huge by the way - the free chips and salsa were tasty as we waited on our food... I did have to go find our waiter at one point - after tracking him down he was more attentive the rest of the night...  The flavors were okay? I don't know how else to describe it - nothing was stand out except portion size - classy presentation and meh service

VWQXFRQ4UJvWOntxqbL2jg.text: Finally a place we can come and have real Mexican food. Everything was delicious and tasty, good size portions.  We will be back

LQ1Rj3NNi3wOmHDGEGQfKw.text: I would love to give this place 5 stars but my husband was not satisfied with his dish. I had the Steak with Shrimp and it was deliciuos. It had rice, beans,vegetables and huge hot pepper. Chips and salsa tasty but salsa could be alittle bit thicker. They gave you a free little tortilla chip with whip cream and strawberry drizzle on it. It was tasty. Friendly and good service. My husband had the Chicken Fajitas. He ordered them due to the reviews. He would have preferred larger strips of Chicken instead of small leftover pieces. I will be back with my mama to try again but probably not my husband.

nlMrlWrexfky_mREcQQwJA.text: I really hate giving a 2 star but in order to give a three star, I have to least want to go back and I just can't say that I want to.  The service was on point - our server definitely stayed on top of providing us with excellent service. So my 2 star is in no reflection of that.   Chips and salsa were banging. The rest of our food was just mediocre. I can't even remember what we ordered now - that is how much it left an impression on me. My son ordered a burger and while it was pretty big - it tasted like they ran it over several times. It was just so tough and dry.  They give you complimentary dessert which is nice but it is just some fried tortillas with cinnamon and sugar.

i5uxV-8nM7uqxH3_DJ4NaA.text: By far NOT the best Mexican around! This is the only Mexican place that does not seem to know how much people love chips and salsa! Filling drinks....don't happen here so order 2 at the start! Be careful when ordering they call thing by different names here! Save yourself the headache and go to another minivan place this one just isn't worth it.

3OWhBGmzknnKQwMJUsW8KA.text: Went down to the Carolina Rebellion last weekend, upon checking out of the Marriot Courtyard near by I hit up Yelp and this place popped up about a mile away. Fantastic service throughout, top notch. Lunch specials were cheaper than what you can pay for some fast food spots. Atmosphere was festive and the margaritas were off the chain. I'd recommend this spot to anyone looking for all around, great Mexican food and outstanding service!

Nothing spectacular. My rice I don't think it was cooked all the way because there were some grains in there that were hard as if they were not cooked all the way. The portions and food are done really well.  The Carne Asada is always a go to favorite.  The Chile Verde is also another good choice.     Unfortunately we just don't frequent this restaurant that much because of the poor service.

gq2Z8fvYUoDSnf-MTlTKPg.text: pros: large portions cons:  taste/quality is average, service (saw waitress maybe 3 times total)  I ordered the enchiladas Rancheras but got a quesadilla instead. 6VxdsVcbOKGJK2aI3iZv9g.text: So disappointed. This was our favorite place but today the beef was so bad in our fajitas and Deluxe burrito that it was not eatable. Do not know what the new taste is for their beef but it will be hard for me to go back.

JrXSX5B45PJPbWhx--vyrg.text: Azteca is tucked behind a hotel in a strip of other restaurants and shops. Parking is a breeze and there is a lot of indoor seating.   They have complimentary chips and salsa. The salsa has a slight kick so sensitive tongues be careful! I ordered a margarita... it was nice and strong. Such a shame that they don't offer specials.  I ordered a chicken quesadilla and the bae ordered a chicken burrito. The food came out quickly and was delicious. It wasn't the best I've had, but it was pretty good. I didn't care for the sour cream that much but it didn't ruin my meal.   Service was good and I had no complaints. Overall, this place is pretty solid, especially for the area.

HDib2W3eZ8CE9lzEltQcQw.text: I dont know about the other guest reviews but my experience was excellent.  I ordered a burrito on a plate with rice and beans. The quality of the asada so supper high. I could only imagine where they purchase there meat from because it was far better then any other restaurant I ate at. Supper friendly and quick service.

HmzyeLxVgvfnaCUWKGYcGg.text: Ehhh I'm updating my review because I want to give them kudos to how well they handled the HUGE cinco de mayo crowd. My coworkers and I showed up around noon and the place was P - A - C - K - E - D. We were group of five and were able to be seated immediately.  Our waiter came to greet us and let us know there was a margarita special: order a margarita, get a free t-shirt. Unfortunately, the waiter failed to share that there was a price markup during the ordering process, but more on that later.  Two baskets of chips and salsa were brought out for the table and our food orders were placed. We plowed through both baskets of chips and salsa and another waiter kindly brought out two more baskets while we waited. Our food did seem to take a little longer than normal but it ended up being all right in the end. I went with the chicken carnitas lunch special and liked it, nothing great but good enough.   Once it was time to cash out, my co-workers who'd placed margarita orders were shocked to see that the amount was $11-$12 for their drinks rather than the normal $8 or $9 for margaritas. Just would've been nice if the price increase would've been explained.  I went solo a few weeks later because I had a vicious craving for huevos rancheros. I was disappointed once my food came out because there wasn't much egg (huevo) to be found. I ordered the rancheros with chorizo and it was basically a plate filled of chorizo. The beans and rice were not that great and it was just, overall, not a good meal. I was very disappointed.  Can't say that I'll be going back anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Complimentary chips and salsa. Salsa is on the runny side but has a little bit of a kick
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chorizo con huevos. Mucho chorizo, not much huevo (egg)

gZNzuRtZe6oSguxrYpm2gQ.text: Hmmm, well here this goes....  For starters, very fancy beautiful, colorful restaurant. Fast paced and steadily busy from what I see.   I've been here a few times.  The menu is huge with selections /dishes. The downside from this place in comparison to other Mexican restaurants is this place is pricey on their menu. I can get the same quality of dishes for lesser price somewhere else.   With that being said, they have some of the best Queso in the area!!!. They serve you a huge bowl for $5.50. I am particular over salsa. I personally enjoyed theirs. It's full of onions, cilantro and peppers drowning in a garlicky tomato puree. My husband didn't quite like but he's no fan of onions as I am. The Chips are just ok.   The service was decent,  no complaints.    I may return someday when I forget that I don't like the flavor of their steak or the Tostado soup was not chicken broth tasty. For presentation. It looked awesome! The taste just didn't sit well with me. Maybe on a Queso quest, I'll be back!!!

2ct_hvT4pZ7cxvTWgjwruw.text: Family and i are new to the area.  A friend took us to this restaurant.  I was impressed on how clean this place was (its a big restaurant), service from our waiter was an A+, food was also good.  Only bad detail i can point out is the faucet in the bathroom area (men's),  if you are in formal attire just be carefull, that faucet will splatter the watter all over.    (It may be embarrassing on a date).  *Make sure you order the spicy salsa for your chips, otherwise you be dissapointed with the "watery" one.

Bfl_6DO_yK1Vq00lD530Pw.text: This is by far one of the worst restaurants that I have ever been to. When we arrived at the restaurant the other 4 people from our party were already there for 20 minutes, none of which had received even their water. Once we arrived it was another 20 minutes before our waitress came to the table to get our drink order. From there on it was only downhill. Our waitress had an awful attitude. we had to repeatedly ask for things such as BAISC things like salsa, chips, water. These are things are expected from a customer at a restaurant one would think. To put us over the top in our final bill they had charged us for THREE 16oz salsa's ($14.95 total) which our table NEVER received. When we asked to speak to the "manager", whom we do not believe was the True manager of this place, he said "oh I don't know your table ordered so you have to be charged" and then walked away from us without listening to anything we had to say. He went as far as to threaten us saying he would call the police if we were not willing to pay for our extra salsa.   It is safe to say that we will NEVER be returning here. We will NEVER recommend this restaurant to anyone we know. If you are looking for good service and good food you this is not the place for you.

nGc8hmIcrsLaJRBSgfzYGg.text: Let's see... When I went here this evening for dinner I had high hopes. Coworkers absolutely raved about the food. Even Yelp said that I'd been here twice but left no reviews. So I looked through the vast menu as I perused some very watery salsa & decided on the Deluxe Burrito with beef. Literally 2 minutes later I received a piping hot plate of food! Chef Mike must be playing his A game tonight I thought. While the food was piping hot it had no flavor at all. So I ordered a small dish of fresh jalapenos & they had no flavor or heat! It was a definite WTF moment for me because I started to have an inkling of why I hadn't submitted any previous reviews. Azteca may have some good dishes but the Deluxe Burrito isn't one of them. I felt like I was in an upscale Taco Bell except that my burrito was $20 after the drink, tip & taxes were factored in instead of the $5 or $6 that Taco Bell would've charged. Now that I have a review up I'll remember why it is that I don't eat here.

64boe0b-EfwrsrkiqQECOw.text: Highly recommend. Excellent service, clean and very good food. My wife and I found our go to Mexican restaurant!

iJTttwzrZ6sKMQ1BVjITyQ.text: have tried this restaurant 2 times in the past few months.terrible! food and service....do not recommend!

tUiB9zpjVfW0iWSsw8jgqQ.text: I just flew in and must say I was very pleased.  I checked yelp for a Mexican place and while this was only 3.5 stars it was close by so I took a chance.  It was clean. Staff was nice. Not too expensive and food was pretty good. They even bring u a little desert chip. Which is a nice touch.  Orders the chicken fajitas. Not the best in the world but really good.

L9AdvWafauGX3nBL36tyeg.text: Incredibly disappointed in Azteca for the way they handle my most recent take-out order. I have been a loyal returning customer since moving to Charlotte last year. Unfortunately I will no longer be giving them my business. We ordered some nachos, a shredded beef taco salad and a side order of rice and beans...upon pickup my boyfriend who left his wallet in our other vehicle without realizing asked if he could Apple Pay or give them card info to punch in - that wasn't a possibility so he drove all the way back home to get his wallet, on the way back for the second time he called to ask if the order can be made with fresh chips/new taco shell since whenever we eat INSIDE the restaurant it usually comes out soggy due to all the meat juices...the connection was so horrible and they disconnected. When he arrived he asked THREE different people to change the chips/shell, someone said "it might be cold because of the lettuce but chips will be fine", finally the manager says "let me go back and check" he walks from the bar, says everything is good and hands him our meal. Needless to say I couldn't even pick up a chip and my taco salad was completely fallen apart and disintegrated. I called and asked what could be done since this could have been corrected the THREE times it was asked for while in the store..MANAGERS response is "you called an hour ago it's going to be soggy"...but we asked for it to be remade for that exact reason, and was basically fooled into thinking it was when he handed the bag saying everything was good to go. Manager got extremely rude and defensive then HUNG UP ON ME. I called back and he said once you leave that it's our loss. Then HUNG UP again. My receipt was time stamped at 7:25pm and I called to complain about food at 7:38pm (I made 4 different calls because of the manager hang-ups). Disgusted with this management and unprofessionalism.

OqDCsbv2VFBiYei7LPHj8g.text: It was very busy when we went. The waiter took too long to come and take our order. The food took a long time to come to our table and our order was brought to us at different times. My bacon wrap shrimp was way over done, dry and hard. The beans and rice was not bad. My wife wants to give this place another chance. I dont.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

C-S1x4YVLhK7pyFIQFMk0g.text: Decent food, but the drinks were really shorthanded. Also, I left my credit card there by mistake. I called the next morning, and the bartender said that he had found it. When I want to pick it up, the owner was there and was so angry that I was there to pick it up, he actually had the waitress tell me to come back later. Finally, he picked it up from the cash register and gave it to the waitress right in front of me to hand to me. Not really good customer service, and although your food was adequate, your drinks were stingy and your attitude was even worse. Never will go back again.

qwvqyVtUAoQT4qa5JQw9-g.text: After moving from the west coast it has been difficult for us to find a solid Mexican restaurant until now. This place is pretty good. They are very friendly and the portions are huge! They also offer a Mexican coleslaw/pica with the chips and salsa that sounds weird but is kinda addicting haha, we will be back very soon!

7yJgWkxgl3y4AQHabEyELw.text: The food is sometimes hit or miss, but pretty good more often than not. The daiquiris are ALWAYS good and a really good size for the price. This is a midpoint between a friend and I so we meet here often for dinner and a drink. I've never had to wait long for a table but they can be busy at times. There is also always a large party. Seems to be very popular for celebrations!

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. The daiquiris are always good!

yV0uzLNkoEcoe6a0iVyq5w.text: Please be ware when ordering at this restaurant. I visited the location on Friday and ordered the shredded beef chimichanga. As I cut open the chimichanga I noticed that all of the meat didn't look like it was shredded beef. At first I thought they had accidentally mixed in  some shredded chicken so I brought it to the attention of my waitress. She called over the manager and he proceeds to tell me that the shredded beef is mixed with pork... Excuse me sir, your menu does not state that it would be mixed with pork intact I paid an up charge for shredded beef.  He explains that this is how it is served so I sent the dish back and replaced it with a chicken one. By this time, my taste for the dish was ruined. Then when we got ready to check out we reviews our bill and noticed the prices was completely different from what was on the menu. So my questioned the waitress and she said that the price on the menu was the lunch price. We ask so where is the dinner price. She didn't have an explanation so she called over the manager. Same guy as before he advises that the system charges the dinner price after a certain time.  My coworker when was dinning with me asked well how was I supposed to know that. The waitress never said there was a difference plus we were given the lunch menu when we came in. She asked to see the dinner menu and he said that the menu he just claimed was the lunch menu was the dinner menu. To appease us he said he would charge us the lunch price but he never took our bill in or we to fix it. So we sat there  waiting for our waitress thinking she was going to correct it. When she came over to collect our money we told her that he was supposed to be correcting our bill and explained what the manager had previously stated to us. She went over to the manager and he claimed he never said he would charge us the lunch price.. she said he told her to just take $2 off.   There was 3 of us that was talking to the manager. We tried to get to come back to our table but he ignored us. So basically he lied to our face. Then to top it off when she went to cash us out we still never got the $2 off.  We were still charged regular price.. whatever that was bc we never saw anything with the dinner prices for the items we ordered.  Beware! Especially if u order shredded beef and if you are ordering as the price on the menu may not be the price you end up paying especially if it is after lunch hours.

FspRleTbqLMmtNTYYYAWjA.text: 3.5 stars.  My husband and I frequent Azteca when we have a taste for cheese enchiladas, since theirs are some of the best.    Their salsa is very good, and somewhat spicy.  For starters, we like their queso dip and made-at-your-table guacamole (although I don't think they add lemon or lime to theirs?).    But the main course is almost always their cheese enchiladas, served with beans and rice.  They are larger than usual, and FULL of cheese.  Their beans used to taste like the canned variety, but they are much better now.  I like their rice as well.  Platters are huge, and we both always have leftovers.  As others have mentioned, service can be hit or miss.  It really depends on who you get.  Either way, we always return, because we just haven't found better cheese enchiladas in CLT.

YZgNKAmVNyT6XJv9VSRtbw.text: The best food, the best staff -- just like coming home We always get Carne Asada and Pollo Mole Poblano - both best in town. After trying all desserts on the menu, still haven't found a bad one - but keep coming back to chocolate spoon cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Top shelf margarita, tiny size

YxSpuDrk5pGbOtBbZdxafw.text: Azteca has INCREDIBLE food. I absolutely love the chimichanga and I always order a top shelf margarita. Service is great and quick, too!   I am from San Diego where there's real Mexican food on every corner and I have to say this is the most authentic Mexican food I've had in Charlotte. Delicious!

x5p16wMsBxi_HgFPmHzHeQ.text: It's not too often I give such a low rating, but I just wasn't pleased. The service was terrible, and the food was just food lol. I had to ask for a drink menu several times before asking another waiter. My waitress never bought our drinks, so I went to the bar to order a lime margarita, Heineken, and fire ice (which was on the menu). The bartender had no idea what a fire ice was so, so I had to go to our table to grab the menu and show him the ingredients. Oh yes, I have no experience as a waitress, so imagine me carrying those three drinks back to our table lol. We ordered the pollo con cream and Camarones con hongo. We agreed that our food lacked flavor. . The chicken seemed as if it was microwaved, and the shrimp was over cooked.   The drinks were good though, and in the locations's defense, they were extremely busy. For those reasons, I won't give them one star!

ufRXENBtGGeLvrFj40fyFQ.text: The food was fresh and appealing.  The fajitas was sizzling and the octopus was cooked perfectly.  Would definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Octopus with double rice.

TR1E1dPpjGL91ExjL03dgA.text: I felt rushed by the manager wanting to take away my plate throughout the evening. I eat slower than most trying to savor my meal. He was ANNOYING to say the least.  The black beans were too salty and the chipotle chicken was drowned in the sauce. Not too enjoyable for the price. I will not go back again.

WqZCmZ6-GQPYxC4P9VGDcw.text: This was my 1st time here but not my last!   Extensive drink menu with funny names are always a plus with me.   Food came out hot and fast. Service was attentive

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bahama Mama was great

2YUySSxuVbxh7dDkz2GkMw.text: Ordered a deluxe taco salad. Within literally 1 minute after ordering (not exaggerating), it was brought out to me. That's a red flag...I mean, it must have been sitting back there already made or the chef threw it together in seconds. Either way, I wasn't impressed. My salad was not good...very bland, despite me ordering sour cream and guac on the side. This is my second time eating here..I didn't like the first time and thought I'd give it another try. Well, I know now that I won't be back...not worth it for the cost and the lackluster food

pcFCauuPgCbpo8H8PpKLSw.text: This place is hit or miss. I've been watching way too many YouTube videos and had a massive craving for Mexican food. Should've saved my money.  I've been here many times before and it was usually a good experience. I'm sad to say that today was not one of them.   I ordered takeout - 2 Fiesta Burritos and a side of queso.  When I got home, I noticed one burrito was overflowing with cheese while the other barely had any on It. They placed the sides in a separate container- rice, refried beans and cabbage slaw. Well one dish was missing the slaw. The rice was hard and stuck together in lumps. The worst part is the beans - they were dry dry dry dry. It wasn't even mashed right. Barely mashed beans, most of It was still whole. I tried to mash them myself and the plastic fork broke. Taking a bite out of dry hard pinto beans is so not what I expected. I trashed the beans.   The hostess who took my order was very nice and the food came out fast which is why I gave 3 stars. I took two off for the horrible beans and inconsistent food quality and quantity.   Next time I have a Mexican food craving, I'll hit up a taco truck.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

T6-3Wa0wkWj591J2lQTIKw.text: Average food and service.  I've had better and worse.  I come here because portions are large and I can get in and out quickly.  The pico is served with lettuce mixed in, at least that's happened to me twice in the five plus times I've eaten here.  Makes for harder eating with the chips.  It doesn't do much flavor wise.  You can never go wrong with the fajitas.  (Except the shrimp, they were not seasoned and seemed to be added as an afterthought.). The beans are also good.  Rice is usually dry and lacks flavor.  Cheddar cheese is what's used here.  I wish they didn't; I love and prefer the traditional white cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salsa and Pico
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Enchilada 2 Taco combination
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken fajitas

_tFcIZYPrfDkyP6DEKViKA.text: Excellent service and food, great atmosphere and staff.  For sure we will visit again! Chuy is the best! The menu has plenty of great choices.

gk3BUg8qyUNEPCTP5LwF0A.text: Great food as usual. The place is wonderful and people wonderful. Can't say enough good things about the people or the place. Wonderful wife chose it and she hit a home run. Ole

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Us eating

Gxpy-z_fIwqVpwHxoWNIIA.text: Like mexican food? ME too! Like authentic mexican food? There is no such thing... no matter where you are and who is cooking or where the ingredients came from some jack-hole will say it's not like they make in a completely different part of mexico. (Mexico should have regional styles like China does: hunan, sichuan, cantonese... so I can enjoy my lunch without the prattle) BTW: Azteca does strawberry drizzle -n- whipped topping on fried tortillas in lieu of fortune cookie with the check so maybe it's coming. Came in with a group from work and everybody seemed OK with what they got except that to a man it was "too much food." I had the milenesa which is basically chicken fried steak done better: pounded thin and lightly bread crumbed, served with avocado, peppers/onions/peppers, rice, and beans with choice of corn or flour tortillas. took half of it home for dinner tomorrow because I'm still full from lunch today...

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. sun mirror thing
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. cool looking giant circle thing...
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. decor and a TV

-yB8UEKnqUtyIm4Zv8qnJQ.text: I've tried a number of Mexican restaurants in the Charlotte area and this one is by far the BEST. The food is well seasoned but not overbearing with Adobo like many Mexican restaurants here like to do. Rather you can taste it in the food that natural herbs and spices have been used like good home cooking. I have tried the shrimp burrito which isn't on the menu but can be custom made for a small upcharge from the steak burrito. The burrito was loaded with shrimp and not something average you would get from Chipotle. My favorite dish was the combination plate that has steak, chicken, and quesadillas. The chicken and steak were extremely moist and flavorful. Of the three, I would have them make the quesadillas chicken instead of churizo because I wasn't a fan of that meat. The prices are very reasonable and family friendly. Definitely check out the pomegranate cheesecake because it is nothing one can ordinarily get somewhere and it's all natural goodness.  If you want a winner for your buck then this should be your next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Double chicken and steak combo meal

dUTYCsq6hNAwUWoyWXr1Lg.text: The salsa was watered down but tasted okay. I ordered the steak fajita. The steak had a very unpleasant taste to it, almost like some type of cleaning product. When I walked in I had to call someone upfront to be seated. Apparently, the manager or whomever she was had an attitude problem & sneered at me. Well I sneered right back.   While I was trying to get thru my disgusting meal, a waiter came over and actually did start spraying the table behind me with some really strong cleaning spray. I could not imagine why he would think it was a good idea to do that.   I won't be back. I'll just head over to three amigos for a decent Mexican meal.

rquQ_5S4oePw82RGVIDRaw.text: Please come here! Fast and quality service, good prices, and phenomenal authentic food!

Y3TKVZQc1qN0FKEIXju9Mw.text: You have to drive to the waaay back of the shopping center, but once you find it, it's great! We started with fresh guacamole & a half carafe of Sangria. My husband had the whole fish & said it was very good. I stuck with enchiladas & had the green salsa. Delicious!!

poQOaWlQVe_O_H_DNSMUgQ.text: Classic Americanized Mexican food. Nearly everything is served with refried beans and rice if you know what I mean.   The salsa is made in house and is pretty good (a little watery) but I recommend asking for the hot salsa. It is a bright red puree that is actually hot. I have been here 5+ times and will be back again. Their menu is HUGE so I always have something new to try. I recommended the bacon wrapped shrimp, mine were cooked perfectly last time which is a struggle for some restaurants.

tsApE5pQTdozRYEwZ2G-MQ.text: We were in the mood for cheap, crappy, faux-mexican, and this place really disappointed.  If you like tortilla chips with cheese dip, get ready to pay.  $6.50 for the cheese dip and only 2 bowls of chips before you pay $3 for a refill.  The deluxe burrito was plain and lacking any taste.  I'd compare to a burrito from Taco Bell drowning in half a container of sour cream.  The temperature I admit was scolding hot, but that was only because of Senor Mike in the back.  The food arrived, no joke, 2 minutes after ordering, so you know some authentic cooking occurred.  That microwave must get used heavily.  How Americans think this is good mexican food really befuddles me.  We saw many hispanics inside and became even more confused that they would enjoy eating this mockery of the mexican culinary experience.  1st and last time for us.

grEzFj664KkTg1p5yZ6FZQ.text: Our go to spot when we want authentic Mexican food. We come here quite often that they remember our order each time  . Good people & great food for us.

eMtLQm6AyI5lGQ8IpBJ2vA.text: Sit at the bar, let the bartender make you some drinks and you will enjoy great Americanized Mexican food.   The salsa is oddly spicy/flavorful yet watery.  They have a great chicken soup and seafood soup.   Order off the specials menu, the one with the pictures, and you'll do better than ordering from the regular menu.  Charro beans instead of refried.... they also have an off menu shrimp cocktail that's yummy.

OEvymS2zX75UYRJ8FS1Z_Q.text: Best Mexican restaurant in Charlotte.  The arroz con pollo is awesome (chicken in rice with a red sauce on top of melted cheese).  They have some tacos which are not on the menu which are my favorite. They ar called tacos de asada and they bring 4 with a small bowl of beans on the  side.  There enchiladas are excellent as well as their burritos.  To drink try the Horchara, a Mexican rice milk drink.

-5g8_i4dD3DhCPH65uhP3g.text: Don't be fooled. Charlotte doesn't seem to have much to compare. I'm a tough critic because I'm from the west coast. Not that great.

h22QIOtfkhY8nqGrzWQ4Ew.text: Staying at a hotel near by so I ordered my meal to go.  Cute place, seemed very authentic.  Next time, would love to eat there.  My entree was so delicious, I could not stop eating it.  Highly recommend you try it.  You will enjoy your food and you won't leave hungry!

q69tz36cuX0BeV5ojMzmcA.text: I have passed this place for over a year and the parking lot is always packed. The food was pretty good but for the $20 price tag for steak tacos I expected more. The portions were very large however so I guess that balanced it out. I was only able to eat half of my meal the portions were so large. I got 3 tacos and an entire plate full of rice. Only issue with my food was that the tacos were drinched in salsa to the point where they were falling apart (the salsa was just poured over the entire plate and not on each taco).   As for the customer service everyone was very nice and polite. I would definitely go back here again, but just order something different.

2fQEJWKl9531TKJnqs8AZg.text: from all the aztecas rest in charlotte this is the best one.  me and husband we are fun of all the aztecas, rest.  great service and delicious margaritas

Wxlb7U-5JcYRrDdFSv95jw.text: The food was fine and served in a timely manner (refills were slower), but the waiter was rather short with us as he was the other times we were there. Otherwise it was okay.

fH5339VwQKvZtRm6rA-SNQ.text: Very friendly - excellent for large parties great Mexican food - large potions and their make at the table guacamole is amazing - family friendly

Gj7_GMqcLpqo_XHJlrKn5g.text: The food and service are excellent.  The prices are very reasonable.  My only complaint is the drinks can be a little stronger. Try the Pork Canitas.

YqZ6z32ZF5psdvLG_Op8iA.text: Went late (9:30pm) on a Monday night.  It wasn't busy, but I wasn't worried about that.  Decor is nice, lots of seating.  Everything was very clean.  I was seated quickly and chips and salsa were brought to the table.  Chips were nice and hot, but the salsa was gross.  Now, having said that; maybe it was because it was the end of the night, etc.  So, we'll give that a pass.  I ordered the carnas buritto and it was super!  Portions were nice and the food was delicious.  Waiter was very attentive.  I also had a piece of 3 layer cake and it was awesome too!  Can't wait to go again!

Dx8slgLfVGuqib4phBsNwQ.text: I would give it zero stars if I could since I never actually ate the food other than the chips. The chips and salsa were good. The water was wet. That's about all i can say since we waited 35 min after placing our orders before we ever saw our waitress again. We only saw her again after my husband walked over to the bar to complain that we haven't even had water refills. The bartender was surprised but no apologies. We asked for a manager and only then did our waitress see him and run in the back to get our food. She blamed the kitchen for being slammed but once I touched the plate I knew she either forgot us or didn't care about her table since the plates and food were cold.  We only get to eat out once a month due to budget and we weren't waisting our time or money here. Once the food was dropped off no one checked on us or the food. We walked out, left the food on the table. Again we only had chips, salsa, and water. They were not slammed or even busy. And no manager ever came out.

MOMY05ypHlza1KfW9Th87A.text: Traveling through Charlotte? This is right off of I-77, open late and was a great place for a quick meal- we were in and out in about 30 minutes without being in any huge rush. It was a nice break from rest stop fast food options.   Food was standard American-Mexican style. Lots of cheese, not terribly spicy or flavorful, really, and the standard menu choices. Portions were absolutely insane, which means a bonus snack further along your route if you take leftovers.   We had queso, fajitas and a combination plate for $26. Plus, free sopaipillas for dessert!  Service was curt and efficient, which worked fine for us.

uv1iKyYULKz1om5nF-fXFg.text: Azteca is my favorite restaurant!!! The food is always fresh and hot! The service is always excellent as well!!! The margaritas are on point!!! I use to order Arroz Con Pollo for years at Azteca on Woodlawn before the one near NorthLake Mall was built.  But ever since the one on Smith Corners Blvd was built, I am a more frequent customer because it's closer. Now I order Fiesta Jalisco. I am addicted.......you know I have to wash it down with a margarita or two!!!
