Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fiesta Jalisco

dXr1PC728dHK_EBT4-bMzQ.text: Very bad experience. I went with my friend. The guy who served us was very unprofessional. That spoiled our dinner experience here. He was not taking order properly. My friend ordered vegetarian salad and he brought ham salad. We asked him to get new vegetarian salad and he just removed ham on top and brought the same salad which is very annoying for vegetarian guys. Not only messed up the order but the way he talks the way he responds. We asked him to get drinks menu and he forgot that. We asked him to get salsa and he forgot that. The other guys who were serving other tables kind of sensed that we are waiting on something and brought us the menu and salsa. Might ruin your experience too. Think before you go here. I will never go to this restaurent.

Gh_x3E3pXYPFjwKNB5sctg.text: I think we found a good one!  You could officially call me a fan of Azteca.   I came here with a party of 11.  The chips and salsa were pretty good.  I, personally, could have used a little more kick, but what can I say?  I'm a spicy kind of guy!  The margaritas are phenomenal here!  Between my fiancee and I, we ordered a pitcher.  My 3 enchiladas were absolutely awesome.    Service was great!  They even came out and sang happy birthday to our friend.  Awesome job Azteca.  I shall be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

QKR8XjfrHS-7grU6rNjhKg.text: Been eating here for years.  Mostly during lunch.  Excellent menu selection, great service and great tasting Mexican food for a chain restaurant.  Dinner meals are huge and you'll be stuffed when you or if you finish it.

5khGkS-IADOiVic7gp-26A.text: The service was terrible. The food was very basic. The quesadilla seemed like it was microwaved. The salsa for the chips was terrible, it tasted like onions. I'll never eat there again.

crYZLpkzxUmN8VdGyS7bQw.text: I've eaten here with my family at least once every other week since this place opened. I don't know how many times that amounts to??  (100 plus??) Of any restaurant in Charlotte this seems to be about the most consistent if ever been to. I've honestly never had a bad meal here no matter what I get. We usually have  large combo's  ...all under $10.-. You have to ask for some of their salsas,salsa verde, pico de gallo, and salsa de la drilla (nice heat) (all free..just ask) when they bring chips.  Huge portions, reasonably priced home made everything! Their signature carne asada, skirt steak flame broiled to your liking is excellent, and that is around $14.- Their sweet tea is good but if you want to step out try their horchada/rice almond milk with a sweet cinnamon spice..awesome! We drive 40 miles round trip to go here.  I'm glad it's not closer, we'd probably sell our stove.

Pvz0gyUz79IZp5JEM5A6bA.text: This is, by far, our favorite Mexican place in the Charlotte area. Although they have other locations, I think this is the best one. If you like Fajitas, they have the best! The beef is nice and tender and very well seasoned. The service is just as good as the food! If you want a delicious dinner, at a reasonable price, you won't be disappointed here! Skip the mall restaurants, you won't be disappointed!!

Z4CveqosbfTeZJH3JtczTQ.text: The food was delicious, humble but super tasty like authentic Mexican cuisine is. The staff was friendly and the atmosphere was pleasant. I found out about this place yesterday and had lunch there, today I came back to have their dinner!

GNIOH1BvUVA2v28eIiu_yQ.text: I am from New York and was visiting Charlotte with the boyfriend. He loves mexican food. So we decided on this place because of the great reviews. We arrived and was served with house tortilla chips and salsa. The salsa was a bit too spicy for me but the tortilla chips were hot and were good. I ordered the chicken carnitas and the boyfriend ordered the arroz con pollo. The food arrived in extra huge plates and it was not what we expected. The food was delicious but it was so much that we both couldnt finish it. I would recommend this place to friends who are visiting Charlotte.

UhlQA2xU-rdCDZszM6eQ0w.text: Our waitress was rude and pushy and the food was absolutely terrible! I will definitely not be back. Watery salsa and overcooked chips to start the meal. We decided to get the table side guacamole and neither of us were impressed. My meal was mostly rice and beans and the chicken inside the burrito was not good. I have almost nothing positive to say about this place besides their decor. Not sure why they're getting 3+ stars because honestly chipotle would've been better and worth the money.

73fTli3wNmye1kN-9UfmtQ.text: Just like mom and dad used to make! Good food, great customer service. They were so good that I came back two nights in a row and I'm used to authentic Mexican food from Texas.

c-2rpl9teIE1ZunWqz2EHw.text: Great place!! Delicious, fresh food. Great tableside guac. Big fan of the arroz con pollo. Great takeout too!!

oznO7IVOPjyiXpBhHCZDYw.text: Aztecsa is decent, but is reminiscent of a tourist trap. Kitschy decor, costumes, overpriced dishes & drinks, simple dishes were full of overly processed ingredients. My man got the fajitas (which were fresh) and I had 2 burritos. The chorizo had eggs and was the best thing we had. I'll keep looking for my new favorite place.

OWFBs9btm2LYPl0wuwZj0w.text: I've enjoyed Azteca for the past 2 years. However, my past experience wasn't pleasant. For starters the Camarones de Mexicano was loaded with salt and the Pork Carnitas had barely any meat (mostly fat). When I explained to the waiter that the Camarones de Mexicano had too much salt and that people at our table suffer from high blood pressure. He replied "Next time let us know sooner so we can make the adjustment". I find that interesting since there was more than 3/4 of the meal on the plate and the food was on our table for only 15mins. Needless to say our frustration was reflected in the tip. There's always room for professional development or customer service training.

m5bVPzQtrXd1-Ej-DSvO2Q.text: Great service, big portions, affordable prices. I love the queso and enchiladas! My go to mexican spot in North CLT.

I7bQXsXOju72zAn79EQjuw.text: Okay, having been raised in So Cal, don't expect So Cal. But, you can get close, since once you tell them that you want REAL queso in the enchilada and not cheddar they will give you the Mexican white queso.  The enchilada sauce is more Texas style, so you may want to go Verde.  The carne asada is quite good! get a side of pico de gallo and toss it in your salsa and you'll be fine.  I special order my margs, and the staff finally has seen my fat face enough to know how I like them.

Fp1zJe9XdgXk7AxCTgNiHg.text: I have been to Azteca in another location before, but 1st time at this location.  Excellent Mexican food, good service.  Always my favourite item is Chicken Carnitas extra spicy, and the food was within the normal wait time (around 30 minutes), waiter checked on us few times to refill water and chips etc.  Overall it was good experience.

YqKCpxUsP9yHpWvzMCTWFw.text: Ola!  Please be seated amigos and...amig-etts.  The side effect of the great food here is me, all of the sudden, thinking that I can speak Spanish.  I love making up words while drinking a one gallon margarita and stuffing my face full of tamales, guacamole (made fresh in front of you), and saucy satisfaction.  This is the best Mexican food I have found thus far in my short tenure in Charlotte.  I have been here almost ten times and I haven't had a bad experience so far.  Now, I don't order the combo dishes, I typically get something like Pulpo, or some chicken, seafood, or meat dish - reliable broad spectrum quality.  I am getting excited about my next visit just writing this.  I envision my next entrance with me bobbling up on a donkey as I rock out a poncho with sombrero and sunglasses with a fork in a napkin sheath.  Don Quixote can inspire.  More re-fried beans please.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hot pepper me please. This one made me cry like I was at the opera.
Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulpo (octopus)

g59O3qmqbAeIBeN2MahpYQ.text: Meh.    The best thing here is the chips and salsa which while I love chips and salsa, it's not enough to make it a meal, especially after spending the afternoon drinking beer.  I ordered a combination of enchilada, taco, and tamal.  The taco consisted of mostly shredded lettuce.  The tamal was chicken, I was expecting pork.  And while there were no noticable flaws with the chicken enchilada, it really had no flavor.  The plate was huge but it was filled mostly with rice and beans.  Another flaw was I ordered an unsweetened iced tea and while the original order was correct, the refills were not.  This happens a lot in Mexican places.  If I wanted to drink sugar water with tea coloring, I would have ordered it!  And the worst thing of all from this experience is it sat with me the rest of the night...and not in a good way.

8O-ssSgh4D2UPwwtK6X3mg.text: Excellent!!  We got a shrimp entree and a chimichannga. Both were delicious!  The shrimp was perfectly cooked and the chicken was moist!  Definitely will be back when in the area. Yum and the margaritas were pretty tasty too!!

U5-UXvOoFIXpVPeAn3ELTA.text: Stopped here because it was close to our hotel, very glad we did!  First things first, the staff.  We were greeted immediately by a friendly young lady, and then every member of the staff we walked past on the way to our table said hello.  It is a big comfortable restaurant, very simply done.  The menu is large, something for everyone's taste.  Our sever was with us immediately and we had our drinks in minutes.  Complimentary chips and salsa (with pink chips) were very good!  We both ordered a taco salad and it did not disappoint!  Large portion of ground beef in a tasty shell!  Our beverages never went below half, and as a plate was finished, it was removed.  I couldn't leave without trying the flan, another excellent choice!  We left feeling full and had two drinks, chips and salsa, two taco salads, and a dessert for less than $24.  As we were leaving, every member of the staff we walked by said goodbye and thanked us.  In a time when it is difficult to have employees pay attention to you (because they are on their phones or talking to each other), that was definitely not the case here!  Nicely done!

_jJl9roH5mvCkeHWVFI22A.text: Boy, do I miss the salsa here!!! Actually, I really miss all of the food here. I didn't discover Azteca until my last year of college when I moved to the Northlake area.  This was a frequent dine-in and take-out spot for me. The salsa was always on point with lots of cilantro and onions. I actually try to base my own homemade salsa on the salsa here. It's just that good!  The cheese enchilada has always been good here as well as the beans. Everything here just always tastes fresh.  They also have massive burritos I've seen my friends order.  This is one of my favorite restaurants overall in the Charlotte area. It's also less gringo than some of the places in University.

vX0-Je6e_M_qCNycBG70vA.text: My favorite Mexican food in north Charlotte! We always sit at the bar where the bartender, Nacho, (yes that's really his name) takes great care of us. My fiance and I always get the cheese dip and arroz con pollo (with cheese sauce instead of tomato sauce).  The service is always on point and the portions are huge!  The restaurant stays pretty busy even though it's off the main road but there is plenty of seating.  Clean restaurant and always an enjoyable experience!

bOuL2vAk9G22Yq5hy8vpvA.text: I suppose there are both pros and cons in having a pretty solid Mexican restaurant right up the road from your home. The obvious pro being the accessibility to great food and drink (generally Dos Equis or Modelo for me), followed swiftly by the obvious con of un-doing your exercise routine for the day.   But in any case, I generally enjoyed this restaurant with the exception of cost. In the grand scheme of things, it isn't necessarily pricey. It is generally comparable to other Mexican restaurants. For me, if I'm looking for a quick, around-the-corner Mexican restaurant- this is definitely the place to be. If I'm looking to penny-pinch, I'd drive a few minutes down WT Harris towards the university and hit up Zapatas (my absolute fan favorite).   I generally liked every other aspect of this establishment. The atmosphere and decor were set perfectly for a Mexican restaurant. Good ambiance. The food was well prepared and was pretty delectable. Beer was flowing. The service was spot on. What more can you ask for really?   There were specials here, which most looked appealing.   Definitely worth a try!

ddE0EzuVI18n97UyLhnH-g.text: My wife and I love this place, it is off the beaten track, which means no waiting, and the noise level is low.  The food is delishly, outstanding, I love it all (except for refried beans, I don't like refried beans is why).  The vegetable are fresh and and the food is served piping hot, nothing sits under a heat lamp.  The wait staff is very courteous and friendly.

-uL_omvMYXSgcaGqqHbL_w.text: Came into town to do some shopping. Ate hear because we love, love mexican, however they charge for chips and salsa after 2 baskets, they don't put cheese dip/sauce on anything without an upcharge. Even normal dishes that should have it. Because let's be honest that is the best part about mexican food. The chimichangas and rice where dry. It was also really expensive for mexican. $15-$20 a plate. Not ideal for the mexican food I was served. I'm not bashing, just trying to help out fellow yelpers.

Wk0Z8kmKK2EzCoUR7BeCZQ.text: The service was good but the food, drinks, and decor not so much. We went there for lunch and the waiter quickly took our order. While we waited, the musicians came over and asked if we wanted a song. We politely declined but the table in front of us accepted and in turn we received a song anyway. lol. While we waited for our food I took in the decor and noticed how outdated and dingy everything seemed. I started to feel a little uncomfortable because the place looked like it hadn't had a thorough cleaning in forever. Our menus were dirty and grimy too. The food arrived and my taco was soft and mushy and the shell split right down the middle and the mushy beef filling spilled onto my plate. My chicken taco was only half filled and tasteless. My boyfriend ordered a sizzling fajita and offered me a taste. It tasted way better than the tacos. He ordered a Mojito and he was shocked when an electric green liquid came out. It was literally the color of green kool-aid or some crazy kiddie drink and it had little green flecks floating in it. We assumed the flecks were bits of mint but the drink had no mint flavor at all. It did have plenty of alcohol but no other real flavor. We may give them another try but will most likely try a different location.

yuTmygiBmn6-K5tZnlBx0w.text: This place was awesome! Really great service and the food was delicious! Would recommend the chicken fajita quesadilla and the coco margarita! Both were soooo good!

Kvj3EFQ_RhE4zyprVprAEg.text: Awesome atmosphere here.  They have a mariachi band, fresh ingredients for guacomole and salsa, great margaritas, and great food.  I had the pollo chipotle and it was fabulous.  Definitely a great place for your go to Mexican restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Was only in here for a couple of minutes and realized it was a good choice.  Great atmosphere, great food, fresh salsa and quac!

UwLx1o7Ed1Z0G7zTKio2Bg.text: I am from Dallas, Texas transplanted to the Charlotte, North Carolina area. As an aficionado of Mexican cuisine, Azteca Family Restaurant Is the BEST Mexican food I have EVER had. You won't find your palate wanting when you eat here. The service is excellent and the management is second to none.   Five-out-of-five stars, Azteca Family Restaurant is a six.

Nb4NxkVu1MaWPK1UgTydow.text: Best Mexican restaurant on the north side of Charlotte! We love La Unica, but the wait is much less here and the food is insane!

63IluJgR30UAGd64BqTiuA.text: Had dinner and drinks at Azteca this weekend with a friend of mine. The restaurant itself is quite large and had a festive aura. Upon arriving, I sat at the bar (as I waited for my friend) and had a top shelf margarita. The margarita itself was strong. As a bartender, I tend to like mine a bit more subtle w the alcohol, but I'm a bit crazy like that. The bartender was affable and hard at work. He ran the bar nicely.  When my friend arrived we grabbed a table. No reservations on weekends keep in mind. Our server was quiet and a bit hurried. I understand that because it was a Saturday night. When we did order (burritos and a chicken dish in a cream sauce) our food came quickly. The chips that came with salsa were bland and too thick to me. The entrees themselves were on plates larger than a small country. It was aesthetically funny to look at. Our meals were good. Not amazing but not bad. I will say the chorizo burrito was quite tasty though.   The pricing was inexpensive. Like most Mexican places, you get a lot of food for the $$.  Would I return. Yes. For what is in the area, Azteca is a decent spot for a quick and filling Mexican dish.

hZJGRYHiMZzC533g2K7pSw.text: I don't recommend calling here for takeout. The person taking phone orders kept putting us on hold, then switched us over to someone else who is unfamiliar with the menu. When picking up our order the person was very unfriendly. Food itself was underwhelming. Just go to Chipotle, less hassle.

-hGN_PA7n-CRcrjo3mpjGw.text: Quick, efficient, good food, excellent drinks, average priced. We went on Cinco De Mayo and it was great! Great environment and everyone had a great time, will be back!

EF1ZEZVeFHHMAmGNf0Lc-A.text: The size of this restaurant is absolutely much more roomier compared to the South Blvd. location. If you've been to one of the Aztecas in mid or lower Charlotte, then you won't expect to see anything different on the menu. However, what you can expect to see is a change in staff every six months or so. I believe they've changed owners once or twice during the time they've been open and have shuffled around the waiting and managerial staff. For the better though. They seem much more helpful and coordinated with their food runs and service.   The food of the restaurant is decent and hits the spot. There isn't really anything special with their enchiladas, tacos, or tamales. I'm not an expert on Mexican cuisine, so I could be totally wrong, but those three items seem to be pretty uniform at any Mexican restaurant. The thing that really bothers me though is the lower quality of meats they have switched to. The chicken tastes like it comes from a Swanson Chicken can and the ground beef they use is the highest amount of fat possible.   HOWEVER, those are the combos. If you really want the "quality" meat and flavor, then you have to go to their speciality items or fajitas and pay a little more money for quality. Nothing wrong in that, amigos. Having learned that the combos aren't really good anymore, I've switched to the Carne Asada and the meat is muchhhh better! Now I actually feel like I'm spending my money for a good reason. Fajitas are starting to show a little more bell peppers & onions than meat lately, so they're starting to slack on that, but the fajitas are pretty standard once again.   I gave it four stars because of the lack of quality they're starting to go to now (I know, the economy excuse), but everything else is great in the restaurant. Friendly staff, clean tables, and decent prices for dinner. Lunch prices are excellent, so don't be afraid to come here for a quick bite if you don't want the same old $5 sub down the road.

photos.caption: Photo of Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch combo.

bHoVMTaZ8MGfapoPh98YKA.text: Some of the best Mexican food north of the border. Queso is great. The Fajitas Quesadilla is fantastic. Haven't had anything on the menu that wasn't good. Soccer is on the tv, and on Sunday's you may find a mariachi group playing.

wKQ5n-i0gGQp5eucWnLK_Q.text: If you don't get the carnita's you're doing it wrong. Server was attentive but never felt rushed. Dining room was lively for a Tuesday night but never loud.

AMXi_r5y3xDzseM0xu6d5w.text: Our go-to Mexican place.  The fresh guacamole is reason alone to go here. They make it table side and you can let them know what you want in it. Always good to bring a couple of bucks for the guacamole cart tip jar.  Service is usually good and they will customize plates however you want. Not too expensive.
